pull.title: [QA] remove some magic mining constants in functional tests
pull.body:
The fewer magic numbers the better.

Also more directly tested a `submitheader` case of bad previous blockhash.

rename.from: remove some magic mining constants in functional tests
rename.to: [QA] remove some magic mining constants in functional tests

events.message: remove some magic mining constants in functional tests
submitheader: more directly test missing prev block header

events.body:
This test also fails for me locally on Python 3.4. If you install [PyEnv](https://github.com/pyenv/pyenv) it will catch this. 

Fixed in #15439

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -164,9 +164,9 @@ def assert_submitblock(block, result_str_1, result_str_2=None):
         assert_submitblock(bad_block, 'prev-blk-not-found', 'prev-blk-not-found')
 
         self.log.info('submitheader tests')
-        assert_raises_rpc_error(-22, 'Block header decode failed', lambda: node.submitheader(hexdata='xx' * 80))
-        assert_raises_rpc_error(-22, 'Block header decode failed', lambda: node.submitheader(hexdata='ff' * 78))
-        assert_raises_rpc_error(-25, 'Must submit previous header', lambda: node.submitheader(hexdata='ff' * 80))
+        assert_raises_rpc_error(-22, 'Block header decode failed', lambda: node.submitheader(hexdata='xx' * BLOCK_HEADER_SIZE))
+        assert_raises_rpc_error(-22, 'Block header decode failed', lambda: node.submitheader(hexdata='ff' * (BLOCK_HEADER_SIZE-2)))
+        assert_raises_rpc_error(-25, 'Must submit previous header', lambda: node.submitheader(hexdata=super(CBlock, bad_block).serialize().hex()))
comments.body: I'm not sure I follow here: which constructor is it that takes `CBlock` and `bad_block` as parameters?
As this constant is used in multiple places, wouldn't it be an idea to define it in a shared place?

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -164,9 +164,9 @@ def assert_submitblock(block, result_str_1, result_str_2=None):
         assert_submitblock(bad_block, 'prev-blk-not-found', 'prev-blk-not-found')
 
         self.log.info('submitheader tests')
-        assert_raises_rpc_error(-22, 'Block header decode failed', lambda: node.submitheader(hexdata='xx' * 80))
-        assert_raises_rpc_error(-22, 'Block header decode failed', lambda: node.submitheader(hexdata='ff' * 78))
-        assert_raises_rpc_error(-25, 'Must submit previous header', lambda: node.submitheader(hexdata='ff' * 80))
+        assert_raises_rpc_error(-22, 'Block header decode failed', lambda: node.submitheader(hexdata='xx' * BLOCK_HEADER_SIZE))
+        assert_raises_rpc_error(-22, 'Block header decode failed', lambda: node.submitheader(hexdata='ff' * (BLOCK_HEADER_SIZE-2)))
+        assert_raises_rpc_error(-25, 'Must submit previous header', lambda: node.submitheader(hexdata=super(CBlock, bad_block).serialize().hex()))
comments.body: The base class is CBlockHeader, so we're accessing its serialization function.
Done, defined right after CBlockHeader is defined
(and added an assert right after for the invariant of 80)

comments.body: Maybe rename `bad_block` above to `bad_hashPrevBlock_block` or similar, and invoke the `CBlockHeader` constructor directly?

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -15,6 +15,7 @@
 from test_framework.messages import (
     CBlock,
     CBlockHeader,
+    BLOCK_HEADER_SIZE

@@ -164,9 +164,9 @@ def assert_submitblock(block, result_str_1, result_str_2=None):
         assert_submitblock(bad_block, 'prev-blk-not-found', 'prev-blk-not-found')
 
         self.log.info('submitheader tests')
-        assert_raises_rpc_error(-22, 'Block header decode failed', lambda: node.submitheader(hexdata='xx' * 80))
-        assert_raises_rpc_error(-22, 'Block header decode failed', lambda: node.submitheader(hexdata='ff' * 78))
-        assert_raises_rpc_error(-25, 'Must submit previous header', lambda: node.submitheader(hexdata='ff' * 80))
+        assert_raises_rpc_error(-22, 'Block header decode failed', lambda: node.submitheader(hexdata='xx' * BLOCK_HEADER_SIZE))
+        assert_raises_rpc_error(-22, 'Block header decode failed', lambda: node.submitheader(hexdata='ff' * (BLOCK_HEADER_SIZE-2)))
+        assert_raises_rpc_error(-25, 'Must submit previous header', lambda: node.submitheader(hexdata=super(CBlock, bad_block).serialize().hex()))
comments.body:
Currentry, minimum required version of Python (test) is 3.4.
https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/master/doc/dependencies.md

But hex() seems to be introdued in Python 3.5.
https://docs.python.org/3.5/library/stdtypes.html?highlight=bytes%20hex#bytes.hex

I got following error when executing this test on Python3.4.
```
AttributeError: 'bytes' object has no attribute 'hex'
```
